resources.string: We care about keeping your data safe. Here is what, how and why we store your data. You always have an option to opt out.

We store your notes, tags along with the content we store additional information like color, create time, update time, etc. related to the note. This information are used to make the service best for you.\n\nIf you have logged in via any device, we also store your basic Google Profile (Your public profile and your email address)
How do we store this data?

If you have never logged in, your data is only stored on your device(s).

Once you log in via Google on the app, your data is synced and stored securely in Google Firebase servers as well as your local device(s).

The connection to the Google servers is encrypted.
What do we do with the data?

The data is used for making sure the app works for you. It allows you to see your notes, sync them between devices, or view them online.

We may use your Google email address, to send you an alert in case of a data loss or breach.

The data is stored on Google servers under these terms https://firebase.google.com/terms/. Besides that we do not and will not sell or share your data with third party companies.

You can always remove the data we store by choosing 'Forget Me' from the app settings.
Click to view the app privacy policy

What happens when we forget you?

We will delete all your data stored online. We will log you out and remove your account, user information from our data.

If you are logged into other devices, once they connect to the internet and open the app, the data is removed on those devices. You can restore that by exporting the data on this device.

If you are unsure, you can always choose this option later in the app settings.
